terms.intro: Welcome to Cronify. By using our service, you agree to these terms.
terms.section1Content: By accessing and using Cronify, you accept and agree to be bound by these Terms of Service. If you do not agree to these terms, please do not use the service.
terms.section2Content: Cronify is a free habit tracking application that allows users to track daily habits, set goals, and share progress with accountability partners.
terms.section3Content: You are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your account credentials. You agree to provide accurate information when creating your account.
terms.section4Content: You retain ownership of any content you submit to Cronify. By submitting content, you grant us a license to use, store, and display that content as necessary to provide the service.
terms.section5Content: You agree not to use Cronify for any unlawful purpose or in any way that could damage, disable, or impair the service.
terms.section6Content: Cronify is provided "as is" without warranties of any kind. We do not guarantee that the service will be uninterrupted or error-free.
terms.section7Content: We reserve the right to modify these terms at any time. Continued use of the service after changes constitutes acceptance of the new terms.

privacy.intro: Your privacy is important to us. This policy explains how we collect, use, and protect your information.
privacy.section1Content: We collect information you provide directly: email address, habits you create, and progress logs. We do not sell your personal information to third parties.
privacy.section2Content: We use your information to provide and improve the service, send important notifications about your account, and enable features like accountability partnerships.
privacy.section3Content: Your data is stored securely using Supabase infrastructure. We implement industry-standard security measures to protect your information.
privacy.section4Content: When you add an accountability partner, they can see your habits, progress, and reasons for failures. You control who you share with.
privacy.section5Content: We retain your data as long as your account is active. You can delete your account and all associated data at any time from your account settings.
privacy.section6Content: We use essential cookies for authentication and session management. We do not use tracking cookies for advertising.
privacy.section7Content: If you have questions about this privacy policy, please contact us through our support channels.

Onboarding.welcomeDesc: Let's quickly show you how to get the most out of tracking your habits.
Onboarding.step1Desc: Build habits are things you want to do daily (exercise, read). Break habits have timers to track how long you've abstained from something (quit smoking, no social media).
Onboarding.step2Desc: Every day, mark your habits as complete or failed. If you fail, you can add a reason to identify patterns later.
Onboarding.step3Desc: Invite a friend or family member to see your progress. Studies show you're 2x more likely to succeed with accountability.
